title: Overheats Under Load / Uphill
symptom_short: Temp climbs when pulling load, hills, towing

likely_causes.cause: Radiator fins restricted (bugs/dirt) or internal clog
likely_causes.notes: External restriction common; internal clog reduces heat transfer.

likely_causes.cause: Charge Air Cooler (CAC) restricted or leaking (boost loss -> heat)
likely_causes.notes: Boost leak increases EGT and coolant temps under load.

likely_causes.cause: Fan clutch not engaging / fan drive issue
likely_causes.notes: Most common for overheat at low speed/high load.

likely_causes.cause: Thermostats stuck partially closed / wrong rating
Coolant level low or air pockets
Water pump impeller worn / cavitation / belt slip
EGR cooler restriction or leak increasing heat load
Wrong coolant mix / poor coolant quality
likely_causes.notes: Too much water or wrong additive package can reduce protection.

recommended_checks: Inspect radiator/CAC stack for debris; clean with low-pressure wash.
Verify fan clutch engages at commanded temp; check fan hub, air solenoid, wiring.
Pressure-test cooling system; check cap rating.
Check thermostat operation (scan ECT vs outlet temp) and replace in pairs/sets.
Check belt tension and water pump weep hole/bearing play.
Check boost leaks and EGT under load if available.
safety_warning: Severe overheating can crack head, damage turbo, and cause engine failure. Stop if temp enters red zone.

title: Overheats at Idle / Low Speed
symptom_short: Overheats in traffic or idling but okay on highway
symptom_patterns: temp rises in stop and go

likely_causes.cause: Fan clutch not engaging / fan hub failure

recommended_checks: Confirm fan roar/engagement when hot; verify command if electronically controlled.
Inspect shroud clearance and missing seals.
Clean cooling stack; check for bent fins.
Bleed system per OEM procedure; check for air pockets.
Check fan hub bearings and air lines (air-actuated).
safety_warning: Idling overheating can quickly escalate; avoid prolonged idle until fixed.

title: Coolant Loss with No Visible Leak
symptom_short: Coolant level drops; no obvious external leak

likely_causes.notes: Can cause white smoke, rough running, coolant smell in exhaust.

likely_causes.cause: Head gasket / liner issue (combustion into coolant)
likely_causes.notes: May pressurize system quickly, bubbles in reservoir.
Wet carpet, foggy windows, sweet smell.

likely_causes.cause: External leak only under pressure/heat (hose clamp, plastic tank)

recommended_checks: Pressure-test cooling system cold and hot; inspect for seepage.
Check for combustion gases in coolant (block test) and rapid pressure rise.
Inspect exhaust for sweet smell/white smoke; check EGR cooler if equipped.
Inspect cab heater hoses/core for dampness.
Replace cap if it fails pressure test.
safety_warning: Combustion gas intrusion can cause catastrophic overheating. Diagnose promptly.

title: Sweet Coolant Smell / White Smoke
symptom_short: White smoke, sweet smell, possible misfire

likely_causes.cause: Aftercooler core leak on some setups (rare)

recommended_checks: Do not continue long-distance driving.
Pressure-test system; inspect intake/exhaust for coolant.
Check oil for milkiness; check coolant for oil contamination.
Run cylinder contribution/misfire test and inspect plugs/injectors as applicable.
safety_warning: Coolant ingestion can hydrolock engine and destroy components. Stop and diagnose.

title: Fan Clutch Not Engaging (Air/Electronic)
symptom_short: Fan doesn’t roar; temps rise; especially low speed

likely_causes.cause: Electrical control issue (wiring, ECM command, temp sensor)
Air leak to fan clutch actuator

recommended_checks: Command fan ON with scan tool if possible; verify response.
Check air supply/lines for leaks and correct pressure.
Test solenoid power/ground and signal.
Inspect fan hub for wobble/noise; check belt drive where applicable.
safety_warning: Without fan engagement, heavy-duty engines can overheat fast. Repair before hauling loads.

title: Radiator/CAC Stack Plugged (External)
symptom_short: Cooling stack packed with debris; airflow blocked

likely_causes.cause: Dust/bugs/oil film trapped between radiator and CAC
likely_causes.notes: Common on highway trucks and construction use.

likely_causes.cause: Oil mist from crankcase breather coating fins

recommended_checks: Inspect between CAC and radiator (use light/borescope if needed).
Clean with proper chemical cleaner if oily film present (per OEM).
Straighten fins carefully; replace damaged cores if necessary.
Check breather routing and blow-by if oiling repeats.
safety_warning: Restricted airflow leads to overheating and high EGT under load.

title: Radiator Internal Clog / Poor Flow
symptom_short: Overheats; hoses temps uneven; poor circulation

likely_causes.cause: Scale/rust from wrong coolant or neglected maintenance

likely_causes.notes: Wrong coolant mixing can create sludge.

recommended_checks: Use IR thermometer to map radiator temp delta.
Check coolant condition and history; test pH and freeze point.
Flush per OEM procedure; consider professional cleaning.
Replace radiator if flow is restricted or tubes blocked.
safety_warning: Poor flow can cause persistent overheating and engine damage.

title: Thermostat Stuck Closed/Partially
symptom_short: Overheats; upper hose stays cool then sudden spike

likely_causes.cause: Thermostat stuck closed or wrong temp rating
likely_causes.notes: Heavy-duty engines often use multiple thermostats.

recommended_checks: Compare ECT on scan tool to hose temps.
Replace thermostats as a set per OEM.
Bleed/vent system properly after service.
safety_warning: Running hot can warp head; repair promptly.

title: Water Pump Failure / Cavitation
symptom_short: Overheats; coolant leak at pump; grinding noise

likely_causes.notes: Often from wrong coolant/additives or aeration.

recommended_checks: Inspect weep hole, bearing play, and pulley wobble.
Check belt and tensioner operation.
Inspect coolant for aeration; verify correct coolant and additives.
Replace pump and flush system if cavitation suspected.
safety_warning: Pump failure can cause sudden overheat and strand vehicle.

title: CAC Boost Leak Causing Heat/Overheat
symptom_short: Loss of power + higher temps under load

likely_causes.cause: Split CAC hose or loose clamp

recommended_checks: Inspect all CAC boots/clamps; look for oil mist trails.
Pressure test CAC system to spec.
Monitor boost and EGT (if available) during load test.
Repair leaks; recheck temps under load.
safety_warning: High EGT from boost leaks can damage turbo, pistons, and valves.

title: Cab Heater Weak / No Heat (Cooling System Related)
symptom_short: Poor cabin heat; may indicate low coolant or air pocket

likely_causes.cause: Air trapped in heater core circuit
Heater control valve stuck or actuator failure

recommended_checks: Check coolant level and look for leaks.
Bleed heater circuit per OEM procedure.
Verify heater valve actuation and hose temps in/out.
Flush heater core if restricted.
safety_warning: Low coolant can cause engine overheating even if only heater symptoms appear.

title: Coolant Temp Sensor / Gauge Inaccurate
symptom_short: Gauge spikes or reads wrong; fan behavior odd

likely_causes.cause: Instrument cluster or ECM interpretation issue

recommended_checks: Compare gauge reading to scan tool ECT.
Inspect connector pins and harness near hot areas.
Check sensor resistance/voltage per spec.
Repair wiring and clear codes.
safety_warning: Don’t assume it’s only a sensor—verify real temperature to avoid engine damage.
